attributes.comment:
My husband and I are adopting a child internationally. It is tough enough that the
fees for adoption are so high already. Most of the fees are charged by US
agencies, such as fingerprinting at the federal level AND state level, obtaining the
proper documents (our birth certificates, marriage certificates, etc.) PLUS state-
certifications, and the adoption agency fees. Also, with the international adoption
process lengthening, most of the time all these documents expire before the
adoption is finalized. Instead of giving us a break, we have to pay for all these fees
all over again. This proposed bill will increase the fees by more than 50% if
passed!!! This means, the fees we pay USCIS will increase by 100% if the
application expires before the adoption is finalized. Please stop the proposed
increase in fees! Thank you.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Berylle Reynolds
